labs_and_diagnostics: Hematocrit: 6.7 g/dL (microcytic anaemia) Mentzer index: >13 Vitamin b 3 supplementation: recommended Iron folic acid supplementation: recommended Albendazole: single dose Hiv test: negative Full blood count: {"hemoglobin": "6.7 g/dL (microcytic anaemia)", "MCV": "unknown"} Vitamin b 3 deficiency: suspected Dietary counselling: recommended
differential_diagnosis: Pellagra: suspected Hiv infection: considered Tuberculous meningitis: considered Cryptococcal meningitis: considered Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy: considered
management_and_clinical_course: Initial treatment: vitamin B_3, iron, folic acid supplementation, albendazole Clinical improvement: settled within a week Diarrhea stopped: stopped Discharge: discharged Follow-up visit: asked to come back at 3 months for an outpatient follow-up visit including a repeat full blood count
final_diagnosis: Disease name short: Pellagra Causative agent: vitamin B_3 deficiency Confirmation method: clinical presentation, microcytic anaemia, hyperpigmented rash on sun-exposed skin Evidence: settled within a week, no response to iron treatment
